messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sleep routines
messages.msgSnippet: lol!  tonight, after getting home from the pictures, (Lake Placid, fun :-) ) to find my mum taking the girls upstairs, I end up going upto get them to sleep.
messages.messageBody:
lol!  tonight, after getting home from the pictures, (Lake Placid, fun :-) ) to find my mum taking the girls upstairs, I end up going upto get them to sleep.  BUT!!!  I lie down with them, telling them I'm not going to sleep, just lying down while they go because I have to drive Granny Ruby home.  After nursing on each side, dd2 starts shuffling around, and I can hear mum gabbing on to dh downstairs, so they can too, so I ask dh to close the door.  I go back to bed and get grizzled at for hogging the duvet, HA!  It's a single duvet and I'm just covering myself, so I grizzle back, and I get told to go and take GR home!  So, after getting assurances that they would close their eyes and go to sleep, I did, and they did, and I'm stunned!!!!!
 
Woooohooooooo!!!!!
 
Tracy
 
From: bctswim@...

Tracy,
I can relate to the coughing at bedtime thing! We are just coming off
whooping cough around here and when one of my 3 ds's comes near me while i'm
nursing baby emma to sleep, i lose it!LOL! and run from the scene with the
baby hanging on the breast to find a non-coughing room!LOL!
Bridget

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sleep routines
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/28/00 9:12:25 PM Central Standard Time, bctswim@aol.com writes:  Oh, how scary!
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/28/00 9:12:25 PM Central Standard Time, bctswim@...
writes:

<< We are just coming off
whooping cough around here >>

Oh, how scary! Did you all have it? I'm afraid I would come unglued if I
heard one of my little ones making that awful cough! Best wishes for a
speedy recovery to everyone at your house!


*** KiM ***
runs with scissors
